page.title: 12BULLCROFT COLLIERY
page.content: The Bullcroft Colliery Company was formed in 1908.The sinking of the two shafts commenced in 1909 and they were completed by November, 1911.The Barnsley seam of coal was reached at 662 yards below the surface. The method of working the coal was by long-wall advancing faces.The total length of underground tunnels necessary to service the working faces was about 30 miles. When the Coal Board took over there were 1300 underground and 350 working on the surface.The colliery was closed for coal production in September, 1970 and demolition of the surface was finally completed in 1974.The reason for demolition was it was cheaper to work remaining coal from Brodsworth Colliery.The pit tip has been reclaimed and grassed is used for grazing cattle.
